title: Temporal Reasoning Example
context: John started working at the company in 2010. Three years later, he was promoted to manager.
question: When was John promoted to manager?

title: Temporal Reasoning Example
context: The warranty on my laptop expired last June. I bought it two years before that.
question: When did you buy the laptop?

title: Temporal Reasoning Example
context: Emma won the science fair in her final year of high school, which was a year after she created her winning project.
question: When did Emma create her project?

title: Temporal Reasoning Example
context: The old church was renovated a decade ago. It was originally built five decades earlier.
question: When was the church originally built?

title: Temporal Reasoning Example
context: They moved to a new house a month before their second child was born.
question: When did they move to the new house in relation to their second child's birth?

title: Temporal Reasoning Example
context: The library was closed for renovation shortly after the new year and reopened six months later.
question: When did the library reopen?

title: Temporal Reasoning Example
context: Linda visited Paris during her summer vacation and then went to Rome two weeks later.
question: When did Linda visit Rome?

text: Two weeks after her Paris visit

title: Temporal Reasoning Example
context: The museum exhibition opened last week and will run until the end of next month.
question: How long will the museum exhibition run?

title: Temporal Reasoning Example
context: Tom graduated a year before his sister did. She graduated in 2018.
question: When did Tom graduate?

title: Temporal Reasoning Example
context: The company celebrated its 50th anniversary in 2000, ten years after moving to its current headquarters.
question: When did the company move to its current headquarters?
